Yemen faces a cholera crisis; Arabian Peninsula country accounted for 35% of global cholera cases as of December 1: WHO - Down To Earth Magazine
summary:
Yemen faces a cholera crisis; Arabian Peninsula country accounted for 35% of global cholera cases as of December 1: WHO

Published on: 24 Dec 2024, 4:51 am

War-torn Yemen is suffering from a cholera epidemic, now accounting for a significant share of global cases and deaths as reported by the WHO.

  • Nearly 250,000 suspected cholera cases reported in Yemen.
  • 861 related deaths occurred as of December 1, 2024.
  • Yemen accounts for 35% of worldwide cholera cases and 18% of related deaths this year.
  • Inadequate access to clean water and poor sanitation exacerbates the crisis.
  • Yemen’s cholera response faces a $20 million funding gap.
  • Closure of treatment centers due to lack of funds, risking a repeat of past outbreaks.
  • 18.2 million people, nearly half of Yemen's population, require humanitarian assistance.
“The outbreak of waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhoea imposes an additional burden on an already stressed health system facing multiple disease outbreaks.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO Representative in Yemen

Immediate financial support is critical to prevent a worsening of the cholera outbreak in Yemen, which is already suffering from a long-standing humanitarian crisis.
newTitle: Yemen Faces Severe Cholera Crisis Amid Ongoing Conflict

"Selection Process Flawed": Congress On Appointment Of Rights Panel Chief - NDTV
summary:
Congress Critiques Flawed Selection Process for NHRC Chairperson

Publication Date: November 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Congress party has raised concerns over the appointment of Justice V Ramasubramanian as the chairperson of the NHRC, labeling the selection process as fundamentally flawed.

  • President Droupadi Murmu appointed Justice V Ramasubramanian as NHRC chairperson.
  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge issued a dissent note regarding the selection process.
  • They criticized the process as a pre-determined exercise lacking mutual consultation and consensus.
  • The dissent highlighted the NHRC's role in safeguarding human rights, particularly for marginalized communities.
  • Congress proposed alternative candidates, emphasizing the need for inclusivity and diversity in leadership.
  • Concerns were raised over the impact of leadership representation on the NHRC's effectiveness.
“The NHRC's credibility and effectiveness depend on its ability to embody the diversity and inclusiveness that define India's constitutional ethos.”

This critique underscores the importance of a fair and inclusive selection process in ensuring the NHRC's mandate to protect human rights is upheld.
newTitle: Congress Critiques Flawed Selection Process for NHRC Chairperson

WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1 - WION
summary:
WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1

Date: December 1, 2024 | Source: WHO

The outbreak of cholera in Yemen has escalated significantly, with around 250,000 suspected infections reported, highlighting the dire humanitarian crisis in the region.

  • Yemen has reported 250,000 suspected cholera infections and 861 deaths as of December 1, 2024.
  • There has been a 37% increase in cases and a 27% rise in the death rate in November 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • The cholera outbreak is exacerbated by Yemen's prolonged conflict, economic struggles, and inadequate healthcare infrastructure.
  • A significant funding gap of $20 million threatens to close essential treatment facilities, including diarrhea treatment centers.
  • The WHO is collaborating with local authorities to address the outbreak through various interventions, including improving laboratory capacities and training health workers.
“Waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhea have added immense pressure on Yemen’s already struggling health system.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO Representative in Yemen

This cholera surge poses a significant risk to the population, with millions requiring urgent humanitarian assistance amidst systematic challenges.
newTitle: Cholera Outbreak in Yemen: 250,000 Suspected Cases and 861 Deaths Reported

Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation - NDTV Sports
summary:
Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: PTI

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has shown improvement after being hospitalized due to a urinary infection. His friend, Marcus Couto, has provided updates on his condition and mentioned arrangements for Kambli's medical bills.

  • Kambli was admitted to a hospital in Thane due to health deterioration.
  • He is suffering from a urinary infection but is now doing 'fine'.
  • Couto has requested the hospital to keep Kambli for further treatment, promising that someone will cover his medical expenses.
  • A doctor at Akruti Hospital reflected on Kambli’s positive spirit and good memories shared during visits.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude towards the medical team, stating, "It is because the doctor here that I am alive."
“It is because the doctor here that I am alive... All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them.” - Vinod Kambli

The former cricketer was brought to the hospital by a fan, and his condition is under observation.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation

Konstas' MCG debut confirmed, Head faces a fitness test - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Konstas to Make MCG Test Debut as Head Faces Fitness Test

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Sam Konstas will debut for Australia on Boxing Day, becoming the fourth-youngest Test debutant. Meanwhile, coach Andrew McDonald expresses confidence in Travis Head's fitness after a minor injury.

  • Sam Konstas will make his Test debut against India at 19 years and 85 days old.
  • Coach Andrew McDonald confirms Konstas was notified of his selection.
  • Travis Head is undergoing a fitness test after suffering a minor quad strain.
  • Australia will make at least two changes, with Konstas and Scott Boland replacing Nathan McSweeney and Josh Hazlewood, respectively.
“We said from the get go, when leading into the summer, that we wouldn't shy away, and age was no barrier,” said McDonald.

The announcement of the final team lineup is expected on Christmas Day.
newTitle: Konstas to Make MCG Test Debut as Head Faces Fitness Test

title: RIP Shyam Benegal: President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi, and other leaders of the nation pay their - TOI Etimes
summary:
RIP Shyam Benegal: Leaders Pay Their Respects

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Times of India

Veteran filmmaker Shyam Benegal passed away at the age of 90 due to chronic kidney disease, prompting an outpouring of condolences from leaders across India.

  • Shyam Benegal is recognized as a pioneer of Indian parallel cinema.
  • He passed away at Mumbai's Wockhardt Hospital.
  • Tributes came from President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi, and other notable figures.
  • His contributions were honored with awards such as the Dadasaheb Phalke Award and Padma Bhushan.
The passing of Shri Shyam Benegal marks the end of a glorious chapter of Indian cinema and television. — President Droupadi Murmu
Deeply saddened by the passing of Shri Shyam Benegal Ji, whose storytelling had a profound impact on Indian cinema. — PM Narendra Modi

The loss of Shyam Benegal is felt deeply in the film community and beyond, as he leaves behind a remarkable legacy in cinema.
newTitle: Leaders Pay Tribute to Filmmaker Shyam Benegal After His Passing

title: Global disease resurgence in 2024 highlights growing health threat - Business Standard
summary:
Global Disease Resurgence in 2024 Highlights Growing Health Threat

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: Airfinity Ltd.

The article discusses the alarming rise in infectious diseases in 2024, driven by climate change, decreasing vaccination rates, and new pathogen variants. It emphasizes the need for a coordinated global health response.

  • Record dengue cases exceed 13 million globally, surpassing last year's figures.
  • Significant increase in whooping cough cases.
  • Surge in mpox, oropouche fever, and poliomyelitis cases.
  • Unprecedented number of avian influenza cases in the US, with 61 infections reported.
  • Rwanda reports its first outbreak of Marburg virus.
  • Extreme climate conditions aiding the spread of vector-borne diseases.
  • Declining vaccination rates post-Covid-19 pandemic contributing to disease resurgence.
“The resurgence of preventable and climate-sensitive illnesses highlights the importance of adhering to preventive measures while advancing innovation to address diseases.” - Kristan Piroeva, Airfinity Analyst

Addressing the resurgence of infectious diseases requires bolstered vaccination efforts and global cooperation in health surveillance.
newTitle: Global Disease Resurgence in 2024 Highlights Growing Health Threat

title: "I Deserve It. Let India Decide...": What Manu Bhaker Told Father On Khel Ratna Snub - NDTV Sports
summary:
Some Orders Being Followed: Manu Bhaker's Father Hints At Khel Ratna Snub 'Conspiracy'

Publication Date: July 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Manu Bhaker, despite her remarkable achievements including two bronze medals at the Paris Olympic Games, has been snubbed for the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry. Her father, Ram Kishan, implies a questionable decision-making process within the committee, voicing their belief that she is deserving of the award and criticizing the lack of respect for Olympic medalists.

  • Manu Bhaker won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, making history for female shooters in India.
  • Her father claims there may be a conspiracy behind the lack of recommendation for the prestigious Khel Ratna award.
  • There is a contrast between the Sports Ministry's claim that Manu did not apply for the award and her father's assertions of multiple applications.
  • Her absence from the nominees list has disappointed many supporters, further fueled by previous controversies surrounding her social media posts.
"Despite such a fantastic performance if Manu is not recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna, then I am forced to believe that all is not well in the committee, or some orders were being followed." - Ram Kishan

This controversy raises questions about the integrity of the awards process and highlights the challenges faced by athletes in India. Manu Bhaker's story reminds us of the need for recognition and support for those who achieve excellence in sports.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker's Father Accuses Sports Ministry of Conspiracy Over Khel Ratna Snub

title: Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's decision to eliminate the ‘no detention policy’ for Classes 5 and 8 has been met with resistance from the Tamil Nadu government, which will continue its current policy to support underprivileged students.

  • The Union government scrapped the ‘no detention policy’, allowing failure in year-end exams for Classes 5 and 8.
  • Tamil Nadu education minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi criticized the decision as detrimental to underprivileged students.
  • The state will draft its own State Education Policy and maintain automatic promotions for its schools.
  • At least 18 states and Union Territories have already abolished the ‘no detention policy’.
  • No child can be expelled from any school until completing elementary education.
“The current method of no detention policy will continue,” said Tamil Nadu's Education Minister.

Despite the Centre's changes, Tamil Nadu remains committed to its educational practices aimed at supporting less privileged students.
newTitle: Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it

The passing of Shyam Benegal, a legendary filmmaker and pioneer of Indian parallel cinema, has evoked heartfelt tributes from prominent figures including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu.

  • Benegal passed away at the age of 90 due to chronic kidney disease.
  • PM Modi expressed his condolences, saying Benegal's storytelling profoundly impacted Indian cinema.
  • President Murmu highlighted his role in creating a new genre of cinema and recognized his numerous awards, including the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.
  • Tributes poured in from various celebrities and political leaders, reflecting on his immense contribution to Indian cinema.
  • He was remembered for films like Ankur, Manthan, and Mandi, which reshaped Indian filmmaking.
“His contribution to the development and glory of Indian cinema is invaluable.” - Devendra Fadnavis, Maharashtra Chief Minister

Shyam Benegal's legacy as a filmmaker will continue to inspire future generations in the world of cinema.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema

The share allotment status for the Mamata Machinery IPO will be finalized on December 24, 2023, following an overwhelming response from investors.

title: Hospitals cannot refuse free medical treatment to rape, acid attack victims: Delhi High Court - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi High Court Mandates Free Medical Treatment for Rape and Acid Attack Victims

Published Date: December 24, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The Delhi High Court has ruled that all hospitals must provide free medical treatment to survivors of sexual violence and acid attacks, emphasizing that refusal to do so is a criminal offense.

  • Survivors must receive necessary medical treatment including first aid and diagnostic tests.
  • Complaints will be registered against medical professionals refusing treatment under Section 200 of BNS, 2023.
  • The court ordered awareness and compliance from all healthcare facilities regarding these rules.
  • A board stating that free treatment is available for such victims must be displayed in all medical facilities.
  • Those failing to comply could face up to one year in prison.
“Free out-patient and in-patient medical treatment is available for victims/ survivors of sexual assault, rape, gang rape, acid attacks, etc.”

This directive highlights the ongoing challenges faced by survivors in accessing medical care and the court's commitment to ensuring their rights are protected.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Mandates Free Medical Treatment for Rape and Acid Attack Victims

summary:
US sues Walmart, Branch Messenger for exploiting delivery drivers with $10 million junk fees

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a significant legal action, the U.S. government has filed a lawsuit against Walmart and Branch Messenger, alleging that the companies have imposed $10 million in excessive and misleading fees on delivery drivers. This suit emphasizes the need for fair treatment and transparency in the gig economy.

  • The lawsuit claims that Walmart and Branch Messenger are exploiting drivers with hidden junk fees.
  • Drivers reportedly face substantial charges that diminish their earnings.
  • This legal move is part of a larger initiative to address worker exploitation in the gig economy.
'Companies cannot force workers to bear the burden of hidden fees that eat into their pay.'

The lawsuit reflects ongoing concerns regarding labor practices in the gig economy and aims to enhance protections for delivery drivers across the nation.
newTitle: US sues Walmart and Branch Messenger for exploiting delivery drivers with $10 million junk fees

title: Himachal Pradesh: Over 1,000 vehicles stuck in Solang-Rohtang after heavy snowfall in Manali, 700 tourists rescued - Hindustan Times
summary:
Heavy Snowfall Causes Traffic Chaos in Manali, 700 Tourists Rescued

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A fresh spell of heavy snowfall in Manali has trapped around 1,000 vehicles, with tourists stranded for hours between Solang and Atal Tunnel. Authorities launched a rescue operation, successfully moving about 700 tourists to safety.

  • Heavy snowfall created major traffic jams in Manali, leading to the stranding of tourists.
  • Rescue operations were initiated by police to assist stranded individuals.
  • The influx of tourists during the holiday season exacerbated the situation.
  • In contrast, Shimla experienced a joyful winter ambience due to fresh snowfall.
“The snowfall is such a beautiful sight. The weather is amazing. We didn't expect this at all, but when we woke up this morning, there was snow,” said a tourist from Haryana.

This snow incident highlights the challenges of tourist management during peak seasons while illustrating the joy snowfall brings to the region, enhancing the tourist experience.
newTitle: Heavy Snowfall Causes Traffic Chaos in Manali, 700 Tourists Rescued

title: 'I am alive because…': Vinod Kambli clutches doctor's hand, gives first statement from hospital bed - Hindustan Times
summary:
Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, recovering from clots in his brain, expressed profound gratitude to his doctors for saving his life during an emotional hospital statement while receiving treatment in Thane.

  • Kambli was hospitalized due to clots in his brain, reportedly in critical condition.
  • He recounted a touching moment of holding his doctor’s hand and thanked them for their care.
  • His condition deteriorated recently after suffering from a urinary infection.
  • Despite past financial struggles, Kambli expressed commitment to rehabilitation if offered help by the cricket community.
  • Acknowledged support from fans and the medical team during his recovery.
"I am alive because of the doctors here. All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them," said Kambli.

Kambli's ongoing recovery brings hope, as he remains grateful for the support from both healthcare professionals and fans, highlighting a poignant chapter in his life.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment is finalized today, with successful bidders receiving shares in their demat accounts and refunds for non-allottees initiated on December 26.
